files.patch:
@@ -1725,0 +1725,15 @@ +

Building for Windows AArch64

+

Cygwin on a Windows AArch64 machine is an x86_64 environment. As a +result, the build environment defaults to generating Windows x86_64 +builds. To work around this behavior, use the --build +option to generate a native Windows AArch64 build:

+
bash configure \
+  --with-boot-jdk=$BOOT_JDK \
+  --build=aarch64-unknown-cygwin
+

To generate Windows AArch64 builds using Cygwin on a Windows x64 +machine, the target platform needs to be set to +aarch64-unknown-cygwin to enable cross compilation. +Configure the build with --openjdk-target:

+
bash configure \
+  --with-boot-jdk=$BOOT_JDK \
+  --openjdk-target=aarch64-unknown-cygwin

@@ -1460,0 +1460,23 @@
+#### Building for Windows AArch64
+
+Cygwin on a Windows AArch64 machine is an x86_64 environment. As a result, the
+build environment defaults to generating Windows x86_64 builds. To work around
+this behavior, use the `--build` option to generate a native Windows AArch64
+build:
+
+```
+bash configure \
+  --with-boot-jdk=$BOOT_JDK \
+  --build=aarch64-unknown-cygwin
+```
+
+To generate Windows AArch64 builds using Cygwin on a Windows x64 machine,
+the target platform needs to be set to `aarch64-unknown-cygwin` to enable
+cross compilation. Configure the build with `--openjdk-target`:
+
+```
+bash configure \
+  --with-boot-jdk=$BOOT_JDK \
+  --openjdk-target=aarch64-unknown-cygwin
+```
+
